docs.text: Stochastic Optimization 🔗 Home Github repository Syllabus 🔗 This class covers stochastic methods of optimization, primarily simulated annealing, evolutionary strategies, and genetic algorithms. The class is 10 hours total and uses HTML presentations and Jupyter notebooks in Python for exercises. The evaluation for this class is based on quiz responses during the first three classes and on a final project. Schedule 08/11 Introduction and simulated annealing Continuous optimization, random search, simulated annealing 09/11 Evolutionary Strategies Population-based methods, 1+1 ES, CMA-ES 21/11 Genetic Algorithms Genetic Algorithm, Multi-Objective Optimization, NSGA-II 29/11 Project Project Resources 🔗 The 2nd year elective class EISC217: Evolutionary Computation goes into further detail on many of these same topics and introduces new topics such as genetic programming and quality diversity. The Introduction to Evolutionary Computing book by A. E. Eiben is recommended as reading for this class.
